str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Capernaum, a town of Galilee. Of Hebrew origin; Capernaum, a place in Palestine.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A double-drachma, two drachmae, a Greek silver coin. From dis and drachme; a double drachma.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I end, finish, (b) I fulfill, accomplish, (c) I pay. From telos; to end, i.e. Complete, execute, conclude, discharge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A double-drachma, two drachmae, a Greek silver coin. From dis and drachme; a double drachma.
